CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, page 9, reads: "Twelfth-Night Fete - Among the persons who fired the giant pile of Christmas trees assembled at Fullerton St. above the site of the Civic Arena now being built in Lower Hill District, were, left to right: George Kountz Jr., owner of a men's clothing store in Shadyside; John Detrick, 6725 Frankstown Ave., who had lived in a three room house at the spot of the tree-burning for quite a number of years; Ward Kerr, owner of the Canine Commissary in the East End, and W. Stephen Snow, of the Huss Brothers Real Estate Company of the West End. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Three men standing holding flaming torches, including John Detrick in front smiling and wearing striped hat, and W. Stephen Snow, facing back, gathered on field with other men, including a police officer, near Fullerton Street
